entries.name: Age
entries: Bugbears reach adulthood at age 16 and live up to 80 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Bugbears live on the fringes of society, where they value self-sufficiency and violence. They are generally chaotic, organizing in loose tribes under charismatic and powerful leaders.

entries.name: Size
entries: Most bugbears are between 6 and 7 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sneaky
entries: You have expertise in the {@skill Stealth} skill alongside proficiency in either the {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Intimidation}, or {@skill Survival} skill.

entries.name: Long-Limbed
entries: When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Violent Savagery
entries: You have disadvantage against saving throws related to being Frenzied.

entries.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If you surprise a creature and hit it with an attack on your first turn in combat, the attack deals an extra {@dice 2d6} damage to it. You can use this trait only once per combat.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak Common and Goblin.

entries.name: Age
entries: Young dragonborn grow quickly. They walk hours after hatching, attain the size and development of a 10-year-old human child by the age of 3, and reach adulthood by 15. They live to be around 80.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dragonborn are taller and heavier than humans, standing well over 6 feet tall and averaging almost 250 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Draconic Ancestry
entries: You have draconic ancestry. Choose one type of dragon from the Draconic Ancestry table. Your breath weapon and damage resistance are determined by the dragon type, as shown in the table.

entries.name: Breath Weapon
entries: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy known as your Breath Weapon.

When you use your breath weapon, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your draconic ancestry. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. On a failed save, the creature takes damage of the type associated with your draconic ancestry that is a number of {@dice 1d10} equal to 1 less than your proficiency bonus. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.
You can use your Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Draconic Resilience
entries: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.

entries.name: Age
entries: Dwarves mature at the same rate as humans, but they're considered young until they reach the age of 50. On average, they live about 350 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dwarves stand between 4 and 5 feet tall and average about 150 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 25 feet. Your speed is not reduced by wearing heavy armor.

entries.name: Dwarven Combat Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, {@item warhammer|phb}, and {@item war pick|phb}.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

entries.name: Stonecunning
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Talented Miner
entries: You dig twice as fast as other races, allowing you to tunnel and mine ore in half the time that it would take for members of another race. If you spend ten minutes planning a course for the next hour of spelunking, you can ensure that any tunnels that you make during that time will not collapse.

entries.name: Age
entries: Dwelves mature at the same rate as humans, but they're considered young until they reach the age of maturity for their culture of origin. For elvish cultures, this is 100. For dwarvish cultures, this is 50. By some cruel twist of fate, these creatures have an average lifespan of about 1,000 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dwelves are 5 to 6 feet tall and have chubby builds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed|phb}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Abomination
entries: You are generally regarded as a monstrosity, though you are a humanoid. You are seen as an elf by dwarves and a dwarf by elves. You have more than likely encountered bigotry and discrimination from whatever society you grew up in, causing you to have to adapt in some way.
Choose an option from the following list:
{@b Abandoned.} You have retreated away from society altogether and become a shut-in. You may reduce your Charisma ability score by 2 to 5 points and redistribute those points as you see fit.

{@b Abused.} What doesn't kill you makes you stronger, and boy have you ever taken a beating while younger. It's a miracle you're still alive! Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level, though your Strength and Wisdom decrease by 1.

{@b Neglected.} Being shunned from your community, you were denied basic education and had to steal to survive, only furthering the bigotry towards your kind. Your movement speed increases to 35 feet, though your Intelligence ability score decreases by 2 and your Wisdom or Charisma (your choice) decreases by 1.

{@b Ridiculed.} You developed thick skin, and learned to shrug off what people say, though if pushed hard enough you will snap. You have a bonus to Wisdom saving throws equal to your proficiency bonus, though you have disadvantage on all saves regarding sanity.

entries.name: Dwarven Heritage
entries: Choose an option from the following list:

{@b Duergar.} When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell enlarge/reduce|phb} spell on yourself once with this trait, using only the spell's enlarge option. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell invisibility|phb} spell on yourself once with this trait. You don't need material components for either spell, and you can't cast them while you're in direct sunlight, although sunlight has no effect on them once cast. You regain the ability to cast these spells with this trait when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
{@b Hill.} Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.
{@b Mountain.} You have proficiency with light and medium armor.

entries.name: Elven Heritage
entries: Choose an option from the following list:

{@b Drow.} You know the {@spell dancing lights|phb} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell faerie fire|phb} spell once with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell darkness|phb} spell once per day with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

{@b Eladrin (Spring).} As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest. When you reach 3rd level, this feature gains an additional effect based on your season; if the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier:

When you use your Fey Step, you can touch one willing creature within 5 feet of you. That creature then teleports instead of you, appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you.

{@b Eladrin (Summer).} As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest. When you reach 3rd level, this feature gains an additional effect based on your season; if the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier:
Immediately after you use your Fey Step, each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 damage).

{@b Eladrin (Autumn).} As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest. When you reach 3rd level, this feature gains an additional effect based on your season; if the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier:

Immediately after you use your Fey Step, up to two creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by you for 1 minute, or until you or your companions deal any damage to it.

{@b Eladrin (Winter).} As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest. When you reach 3rd level, this feature gains an additional effect based on your season; if the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier:

When you use your Fey Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you before you teleport must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn.
{@b High.} You know one {@filter cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard|level=0}. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

{@b Pallid.} You know the {@spell light|phb} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell sleep|phb} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell invisibility|phb} spell (targeting yourself only) once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Casting these spells with this trait doesn't require material components. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
{@b Sea.} You have a swimming speed of 30 feet, and you can breathe air and water.
{@b Shadar-kai.} As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

Starting at 3rd level, you also gain resistance to all damage when you teleport using this trait. The resistance lasts until the start of your next turn. During that time, you appear ghostly and translucent.
{@b Wood.} You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries.name: Societal Feature
entries: Choose an option from the following list:

{@b Dwarven.} You gain {@i Stonecunning}. You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, {@item warhammer|phb}, and {@item war pick|phb}. You also either gain the {@i Talented Miner} feature or you gain proficiency in either {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.
{@b Elven.} You learn Sylvan and one additional language of your choice. You have proficiency with the {@item longsword|phb}, {@item shortsword|phb}, {@item shortbow|phb}, and {@item longbow|phb}.
{@b Human.} You gain two skill proficiencies and one additional language of your choice.

{@b Sea.} You can speak, read, and write Aquan. Using gestures and sounds, you can communicate simple ideas with any beast that has an innate swimming speed. You have proficiency with the {@item spear|phb}, {@item trident|phb}, {@item light crossbow|phb}, and {@item net|phb}.

{@b Underdark.} You gain {@i Superior Darkvision} and {@i Sunlight Sensitivity}. You have proficiency with {@item battleaxe|phb|battleaxes}, {@item handaxe|phb|handaxes}, {@item hand crossbow|phb|hand crossbows}, {@item light hammer|phb|light hammers}, {@item longbow|phb|longbows}, {@item longsword|phb|longswords}, {@item rapier|phb|rapiers}, {@item shortbow|phb|shortbows}, {@item shortsword|phb|shortswords}, and {@item warhammer|phb|warhammers}.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Dwarvish, and Elvish.

entries.name: Age
entries: Genasi mature at about the same rate as humans and reach adulthood in their late teens. They live somewhat longer than humans do, up to 120 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Independent and self-reliant, genasi tend toward a neutral alignment.

entries.name: Size
entries: Genasi are as varied as their mortal parents but are generally built like humans, standing anywhere from 5 feet to over 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are an elemental.

entries.name: Age
entries: Gnolls reach adulthood by the age of 20 and live to around 80.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Gnolls are usually chaotic neutral or evil, though there are exceptions.

entries.name: Size
entries: Most gnolls are between 6 and 7 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Bloodsense
entries: If there is any creature within 60 feet of you missing HP that is not behind total cover, that creature cannot gain the benefits of being unseen by you. {@filter constructs|bestiary|type=construct}, {@filter elementals|bestiary|type=elemental}, {@filter oozes|bestiary|type=ooze}, {@filter plants|bestiary|type=plant}, and {@filter undead|bestiary|type=undead} are immune to the effects of this sense.

entries.name: Bite
entries: You are proficient with your bite attack, which is a melee weapon attack that deals {@dice 1d6} piercing damage plus your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Endless Hunger
entries: You can eat and drink as well as retain the benefits of 5 times more food and drink than an equivalent creature of your size, but must eat and drink 3 times more than the average person to not starve.
When under the effects of starvation, you are frenzied.

entries.name: Rampage
entries: When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on your turn, you may use a bonus action to move up to half your speed and make a bite attack.

entries.name: Violent Savagery
entries: You have disadvantage against saving throws related to being Frenzied.

entries.name: Frightful Appearance
entries: You are proficient in the {@skill intimidation} skill.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak Common, Gnoll, and Abyssal.

entries.name: Age
entries: Goblins reach adulthood at age 8 and live up to 60 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Goblins are typically neutral evil, as they care only for their own needs. A few goblins might tend toward good or neutrality, but only rarely.

entries.name: Size
entries: Goblins are between 3 and 4 feet tall and weigh between 40 and 80 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Natural Cowards
entries: You have expertise in {@skill Stealth}, and prefer underhanded tactics, allowing you to additionally gain proficiency in either {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Deception}, {@skill Sleight of Hand}, or {@skill Survival}.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries: You can take the {@action Disengage|phb} or {@action Hide|phb} action as a bonus action on each of your turns.

entries.name: Fury of the Small
entries: When you damage a creature with an attack or a spell and the creature's size is larger than yours, you can cause the attack or spell to deal extra damage to the creature. The extra damage equals your level. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak Common and Goblin.

entries.name: Age
entries: Halfbloods mature at the same rate as humans, but they're considered young until they reach the age of 50. On average, they live about 350 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Halfbloods are 4.5-5.5 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Stonecunning
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Age
entries: Half-Bugbears mature at 17 years of age and can live to be about 90 years old.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-Bugbears are between 6 and 7 feet tall and weigh between 200 and 300 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sneaky
entries: You are proficient in the {@skill Stealth} skill.

entries.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If you surprise a creature and hit it with an attack on your first turn in combat, the attack deals an extra {@dice 2d6} damage to it. You can use this trait only once per combat.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1):
entries: {@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
{@b Powerful Build.} You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.
{@b Long-Limbed.} When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Goblin.

entries.name: Age
entries: Half-Dragons mature at the same rate as their non-dragon parent, but can live to the length of their draconic ancestry.

entries.name: Draconic Ancestry
entries: You have draconic ancestry. Choose one type of dragon from the Draconic Ancestry table. Your breath weapon and damage resistance are determined by the dragon type, as shown in the table.

entries.name: Breath Weapon
entries: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy known as your Breath Weapon.

When you use your breath weapon, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your draconic ancestry. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. On a failed save, the creature takes damage of the type associated with your draconic ancestry that is a number of {@dice 1d10} equal to 1 less than your proficiency bonus. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.
You can use your Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a dragon.

entries.name: Chromatic Warding
entries: Starting at 5th level, as an action, you can channel your draconic energy to protect yourself. For 1 minute, you become immune to the damage type associated with your Chromatic Ancestry. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

entries.name: Psionic Mind
entries: You can send telepathic messages to any creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand these messages, but it must be able to understand at least one language to comprehend them.

entries.name: Gem Flight
entries: Starting at 5th level, you can use a bonus action to manifest spectral wings on your body. These wings last for 1 minute. For the duration, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

entries.name: Metallic Breath Weapon
entries: At 5th level, you gain a second breath weapon. When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation in a 15-foot cone. The save DC for this breath is 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. Whenever you use this trait, choose one:
{@b Enervating Breath}. Each creature in the cone must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become incapacitated until the start of your next turn.
{@b Repulsion Breath}. Each creature in the cone must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 20 feet away from you and be knocked prone.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Duergar Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage. You also have advantage on saving throws against illusions and against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition paralyzed}.

entries.name: Duergar Magic
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell enlarge/reduce|phb} spell on yourself once with this trait, using only the spell's enlarge option. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell invisibility|phb} spell on yourself once with this trait. You don't need material components for either spell, and you can't cast them while you're in direct sunlight, although sunlight has no effect on them once cast. You regain the ability to cast these spells with this trait when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Dwarvish, and Undercommon.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Dwarven Toughness
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Dwarvish. Dwarvish is full of hard consonants and guttural sounds, and those characteristics spill over into whatever other language a dwarf might speak.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Dwarven Armor Training
entries: You have proficiency with light and medium armor.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Dwarvish. Dwarvish is full of hard consonants and guttural sounds, and those characteristics spill over into whatever other language a dwarf might speak.

entries.name: Unending Breath
entries: You naturally produce the air that you breathe, and can share this air by locking lips with a creature. This also means that you can hold their breath indefinitely.

entries.name: Lightning Resistance
entries: You have resistance to lightning damage.

entries.name: Mingle with the Wind
entries: You know the {@spell gust|xge} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell feather fall|phb} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell gust of wind|phb} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast either spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak Common and Auran.

entries.name: Earth Walk
entries: You can move across difficult terrain made of earth or stone without expending extra movement.

entries.name: Stone Resistance
entries: You learn the {@spell blade ward|phb} cantrip and can cast it as a bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest, as you cause your rough skin to momentarily turn to stone. On top of this, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition petrified}.

entries.name: Merge with Stone
entries: You know the {@spell mold earth|xge} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell earth tremor|xge} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell pass without trace|phb} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast either spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak Common and Terran.

entries.name: Flaming Hair
entries: Fire genasi sport a head of hair that is either made of fire or constantly aflame. They shed bright light out to 10 feet and dim light an additional 10 feet, and can choose to dim their hair at will to half the light they produce.

entries.name: Fire Resistance
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Reach to the Blaze
entries: You know the {@spell control flames|xge} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell burning hands|phb} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell flame blade|phb} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast either spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak Common and Ignan.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Acid Resistance
entries: You have resistance to acid damage.

entries.name: Call to the Wave
entries: You know the {@spell shape water|xge} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell create or destroy water|phb} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell misty step|phb} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast either spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak Common and Aquan.

entries.name: Duergar Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage. You also have advantage on saving throws against illusions and against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition paralyzed}.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: {@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
{@b Dwarven Combat Training.} You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, {@item warhammer|phb}, and {@item war pick|phb}.
{@b Tool Proficiency.} You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

{@b Talented Miner.} You dig twice as fast as other races, allowing you to tunnel and mine ore in half the time that it would take for members of another race. If you spend ten minutes planning a course for the next hour of spelunking, you can ensure that any tunnels that you make during that time will not collapse.

{@b Duergar Magic.} When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell enlarge/reduce|phb} spell on yourself once with this trait, using only the spell's enlarge option. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell invisibility|phb} spell on yourself once with this trait. You don't need material components for either spell, and you can't cast them while you're in direct sunlight, although sunlight has no effect on them once cast. You regain the ability to cast these spells with this trait when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Dwarvish.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: {@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
{@b Dwarven Combat Training.} You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, {@item warhammer|phb}, and {@item war pick|phb}.
{@b Tool Proficiency.} You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

{@b Talented Miner.} You dig twice as fast as other races, allowing you to tunnel and mine ore in half the time that it would take for members of another race. If you spend ten minutes planning a course for the next hour of spelunking, you can ensure that any tunnels that you make during that time will not collapse.
{@b Dwarven Toughness.} Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Dwarvish.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: {@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
{@b Dwarven Combat Training.} You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, {@item warhammer|phb}, and {@item war pick|phb}.
{@b Tool Proficiency.} You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

{@b Talented Miner.} You dig twice as fast as other races, allowing you to tunnel and mine ore in half the time that it would take for members of another race. If you spend ten minutes planning a course for the next hour of spelunking, you can ensure that any tunnels that you make during that time will not collapse.
{@b Dwarven Armor Training.} You have proficiency with light and medium armor.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Dwarvish.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-Dragons have the same size as their non-dragon parent. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Half-Dragons have a base speed equal to their non-dragon parent's base speed. Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to the depths of the Underdark, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Undercommon, and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

entries.name: Variant Resilience (Choose 1)
entries: {@b Draconic Resilience.} You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.
{@b Fey Ancestry.} You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed|phb}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: {@b Blindsight.} You have the ability to see within 10 feet of yourself without relying on your eyes. Enemies within this range do not gain the benefits of being unseen by you.
{@b Drow Weapon Training.} You have proficiency with {@item rapier|phb|rapiers}, {@item shortsword|phb|shortswords}, and {@item hand crossbow|phb|hand crossbows}.

{@b Drow Magic.} You know the {@spell dancing lights|phb} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell faerie fire|phb} spell once with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell darkness|phb} spell once per day with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-Dragons have the same size as their non-dragon parent. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Half-Dragons have a base speed equal to their non-dragon parent's base speed. Your base walking speed is 25 feet. Your speed is not reduced by wearing heavy armor.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to the depths of the Underdark, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Undercommon, and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

entries.name: Variant Resilience (Choose 1)
entries: {@b Draconic Resilience.} You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.

{@b Duergar Resilience.} You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage. You also have advantage on saving throws against illusions and against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition paralyzed}.

entries.name: Stonecunning
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: {@b Blindsight.} You have the ability to see within 10 feet of yourself without relying on your eyes. Enemies within this range do not gain the benefits of being unseen by you.
{@b Dwarven Combat Training.} You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, {@item warhammer|phb}, and {@item war pick|phb}.
{@b Tool Proficiency.} You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

{@b Talented Miner.} You dig twice as fast as other races, allowing you to tunnel and mine ore in half the time that it would take for members of another race. If you spend ten minutes planning a course for the next hour of spelunking, you can ensure that any tunnels that you make during that time will not collapse.

{@b Duergar Magic.} When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell enlarge/reduce|phb} spell on yourself once with this trait, using only the spell's enlarge option. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell invisibility|phb} spell on yourself once with this trait. You don't need material components for either spell, and you can't cast them while you're in direct sunlight, although sunlight has no effect on them once cast. You regain the ability to cast these spells with this trait when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries: Half-Dragons have the same size as their non-dragon parent. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Half-Dragons have a base speed equal to their non-dragon parent's base speed. Your base walking speed is 25 feet. Your speed is not reduced by wearing heavy armor.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Dwarvish, and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: {@b Draconic Resilience.} You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.
{@b Dwarven Resilience.} You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Stonecunning
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: {@b Blindsight.} You have the ability to see within 10 feet of yourself without relying on your eyes. Enemies within this range do not gain the benefits of being unseen by you.
{@b Dwarven Combat Training.} You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, {@item warhammer|phb}, and {@item war pick|phb}.
{@b Dwarven Armor Training.} You have proficiency with light and medium armor.
{@b Tool Proficiency.} You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

{@b Talented Miner.} You dig twice as fast as other races, allowing you to tunnel and mine ore in half the time that it would take for members of another race. If you spend ten minutes planning a course for the next hour of spelunking, you can ensure that any tunnels that you make during that time will not collapse.
{@b Dwarven Toughness.} Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-Dragons have the same size as their non-dragon parent. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Half-Dragons have a base speed equal to their non-dragon parent's base speed. Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Elvish, and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: {@b Draconic Resilience.} You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.
{@b Fey Ancestry.} You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed|phb}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: {@b Blindsight.} You have the ability to see within 10 feet of yourself without relying on your eyes. Enemies within this range do not gain the benefits of being unseen by you.
{@b Elf Weapon Training.} You have proficiency with the {@item longsword|phb}, {@item shortsword|phb}, {@item shortbow|phb}, and {@item longbow|phb}.
{@b Sea Elf Training.} You have proficiency with the {@item spear|phb}, {@item trident|phb}, {@item light crossbow|phb}, and {@item net|phb}.
{@b Swim.} You gain a swimming speed of 30 ft.
{@b Fleet of Foot.} Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.
{@b Mask of the Wild.} You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.
{@b Cantrip.} You know one {@filter cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard|level=0}. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half-Dragons have the same size as their non-dragon parent. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Half-Dragons have a base speed equal to their non-dragon parent's base speed. Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Gnomish, and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

entries.name: Variant Resilience (Choose 1)
entries: {@b Draconic Resilience.} You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.
{@b Gnome Cunning.} You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: {@b Blindsight.} You have the ability to see within 10 feet of yourself without relying on your eyes. Enemies within this range do not gain the benefits of being unseen by you.

{@b Superior Darkvision.} Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
{@b Stone Camouflage.} You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in rocky terrain.
{@b Natural Illusionist.} You know the {@spell minor illusion|phb} cantrip. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for it.

{@b Speak with Small Beasts.} Through sounds and gestures, you can communicate simple ideas with Small or smaller beasts. Forest gnomes love animals and often keep squirrels, badgers, rabbits, moles, woodpeckers, and other creatures as beloved pets.

{@b Artificer's Lore.} Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) or Intelligence (Arcana) check related to magic items, alchemical objects, or technological devices, you can add twice your proficiency bonus, instead of any proficiency bonus you normally apply.

{@b Tinker.} You have proficiency with artisan's tools ({@item tinker's tools|phb|Tinker's Tools}). Using those tools, you can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless you spend 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when you use your action to dismantle it; at that time, you can reclaim the materials used to create it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time.

entries.name: When you create a device, choose one of the following options:
entries: {@b Clockwork Toy.} This toy is a clockwork animal, monster, or person, such as a frog, mouse, bird, dragon, or soldier. When placed on the ground, the toy moves 5 feet across the ground on each of your turns in a random direction. It makes noises as appropriate to the creature it represents.
{@b Fire Starter.} The device produces a miniature flame, which you can use to light a candle, torch, or campfire. Using the device requires your action.
{@b Music Box.} When opened, this music box plays a single song at a moderate volume. The box stops playing when it reaches the song's end or when it is closed.
